channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Brazil's ex-president Bolsonaro detained by police ahead of vigil
Trump officials prepare for potential shakeup after one-year mark, CNN reports
Five tourists killed in Chile snowstorm
Trump says Cambodia, Thailand going to be fine after calls over conflict
President Trump signs government funding bill, ending shutdown after a record 43-day disruption
37 killed in Peru road crash
Trump says no US government official will attend G20 summit in South Africa
US judge rules Trump illegally ordered National Guard to Portland, Oregon
Iranian plot to kill Israel's ambassador to Mexico contained, US official says
Mamdani to Trump: 'Turn the volume up'
Trump tells Ilhan Omar to leave US
Fire at Mexico store kills at least 23
Malaysian floods affect 11,000 people across seven states
item.description: More than 11,000 people in seven Malaysian states have been affected by flooding caused by torrential rain, the national disaster agency said on Monday. Floods are common on the eastern coast of Malaysia during the annual monsoon season from October until March, with thousands of people displaced

item.title: Minor earthquake felt in Saudi Arabia
item.description: The Saudi Geological Survey (SGS) recorded two earthquakes on Saturday - one in Saudi Arabia and another in Iraq, media reports said. According to the SGS, its National Seismic Monitoring Network detected a minor quake about 86km northwest of Harrat Al Shaqa, situated between Al-Ais in the Madinah

item.title: Hamas delegation in Cairo to discuss Gaza ceasefire, sources say
item.description: A Hamas delegation was in Cairo on Sunday to meet with Gaza war mediators, an Egyptian security source and a Hamas source said, as both Israel and the Palestinian militant group continue to trade accusations of ceasefire violations. The Hamas official, speaking on condition of anonymity, said the

item.title: 5.3 magnitude earthquake jolts Myanmar coast
item.description: A 5.3-magnitude earthquake struck off the coast of Myanmar at 10:39 am (Bangladesh time) on Sunday at a depth of 10km. The tremor also affected neighbouring Thailand. According to the United States Geological Survey (USGS), the epicentre was located in the Andaman Sea, about 267 kilometres west-so

item.title: Indian Tejas fighter jet crashes, killing pilot
item.description: An Indian home-produced Tejas fighter jet crashed at the Dubai Air Show during an aerial display on Friday, killing its pilot, the Indian Air Force said. The fighter was flying at a low altitude at around 2:15pm (1015 GMT) before coming down in a ball of fire, according to a witness. Footage from

item.title: Pakistan army kills 23 militants near Afghan border
item.description: Pakistani security forces raided two Pakistani Taliban hideouts in the country’s northwest near the Afghan border, triggering intense shootouts that left 23 militants dead, the military said Thursday. There were no details on any casualties among the military. The raids took place on Wednesd

item.title: Israeli military strikes southern Lebanon after evacuation warning
item.description: The Israeli military carried out powerful airstrikes in two villages in southern Lebanon on Wednesday, witnesses said, pressing a campaign of near-daily attacks in the border region where Israel says it is targeting Iran-backed Hezbollah. The Israeli military said it was striking "several Hezbolla

item.title: Air India lobbies to use airspace over China's Xinjiang as financial woes mount
item.description: Air India is lobbying the Indian government to convince China to let it use a sensitive military airspace zone in Xinjiang to shorten routes as the financial toll from a ban on Indian carriers flying over Pakistan mounts, a company document shows. The unusual request comes just weeks after direct

item.title: Japanese seafood caught up in escalating diplomatic dispute with China
item.description: China has informed Japan that it will ban all imports of Japanese seafood, media outlets reported on Wednesday, in what appeared to be the latest salvo in an escalating diplomatic dispute between Asia's top two economies. Tensions between the two countries ignited after new Japanese Prime Minister

item.title: Indonesian teen's diary and online trail reveal path to Jakarta mosque blasts
item.description: An Indonesian student suspected of carrying out a bomb attack at his school mosque in Jakarta wrote of feeling isolated in his 42-page diary and drew inspiration from a Telegram group glorifying white supremacist attacks, according to new details from police. The early‑November explosions struck w

item.title: Myanmar refugees join Thai workforce
item.description: Tun Min Lat climbs a bamboo ladder in the longan orchards of eastern Thailand, moving from tree to tree as he plucks the juicy tropical fruit in the sweltering heat of a November morning. For the first time in the nearly two decades he has lived in Thailand, the 42-year-old Myanmar refugee is able

item.title: Indonesia landslide kills 6 in Central Java, 17 missing, state media says
item.description: A landslide in Indonesia's Central Java killed six people with 17 missing, state news agency Antara reported on Saturday, after prolonged, heavy rains. The landslide on Thursday in the city of Cilacap buried a dozen houses in Cibeunying village, Antara said, citing disaster official Budi Irawan.
